instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00840 Power, no Boot.
threads.message:
I've seen several 820-00840 and 820-00875 boards the past ~3 months that all had the exact same symptoms; they power on (trackpad clicks), ppbus is stable at 13v, but there's no other progress/booting. All boards are perfectly clean with no history of drop/liquid/etc. They all came in with similar descriptions, "stopped powering on". I have tried loading new BIOS's on a few of the boards, and it didn't help, so I put the original back on each. No shorts found across all coils, nothing getting hot except CPU (gets appropriately warm, etc). They all power on with trackpad click, fan spin, but no chime/boot/video, etc.

I'm working on an 820-00840 board now, measurements below:

pp3v3_g3h: 3.4v
ppbus_g3h: 13.06v
all_sys_pwrgd: 3.22v
pp2v9_sysclk: 3.0v
pp3v1_rtc: 3.09v
pm_slp_s0_l: 3.3v
GTVR_FCCM: .022v
USB Mouse light flickers for literally .1 seconds then no activity.

ALL_SYS looks very slightly low, but everything else looks fine. CPU gets warm as normal, but no chime/boot/etc. Any ideas?

Thanks in advance!

threads.title: 820-00840 Power, no Boot.
threads.message: Sounds like a bad CPU to me...

threads.title: 820-00840 Power, no Boot.
threads.message: Do you get voltage on all secondary supplies (big coils)?
